subprocess_flow.description: Identify and document all applications within the enterprise. This involves gathering information on each application's purpose, functionality, technical specifications, and business value. The application portfolio will serve as a baseline for future architectural decisions.
success_criteria: Comprehensive list of all enterprise applications
Each application's purpose and functionality are clearly documented
subprocess_flow.purpose: To create a comprehensive inventory of all applications within the enterprise.

step_risks_and_controls.control: Cross-validation with IT and business stakeholders

subprocess_flow.description: Create a conceptual and logical data model that represents the data entities, attributes, and relationships within the enterprise. This involves analyzing the data requirements of the business and defining a standardized data structure. The data model will ensure data consistency and integrity across applications.
success_criteria: Comprehensive data model that represents all key data entities
Data entities, attributes, and relationships are clearly defined
subprocess_flow.purpose: To define a standardized data structure for the enterprise.

subprocess_flow.description: Map the applications in the application portfolio to the data entities in the data model. This involves identifying which applications use which data entities and how the data flows between applications. This mapping will help identify data silos and integration opportunities.
success_criteria: Complete mapping of applications to data entities
Data flows between applications are clearly documented
subprocess_flow.purpose: To understand how applications use and share data.

step_risks_and_controls.control: Validation with application owners and data stewards
